item.title: Learn Overpass through fun interactive exercises From beginner to established developer, learn how to utilize the Overpass API and query language https://osmlab.github.io/learnoverpass//en/ #OpenStreetMap #OverpassTurbo #LearnOverpass @openstreetmap Via: https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/16926

Some work for the OpenStreetMap community in 2024‚Ä¶ üòÄüö∞ ‚ÄúFree drinking water soon available in Belgium's 100 largest train stations‚Äù: https://www.brusselstimes.com/belgium/810782/free-drinking-water-soon-available-in-belgiums-100-largest-train-stations-tbtb So, how would you tag this ? amenity=drinking_water fountain=bottle_refill access=yes wheelchair=yes fee=no operator=NMBS/SNCB #OpenStreetMap #Belgium #water #SNCB #NMBS cc: @openstreetmap
A little how-to on mapping playgrounds in #OpenStreetMap, courtesy of Klenje: https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Klenje/diary/402616.

OpenStreetMap Belgium announces European camera grant project. No less than 20 GoPro Max cameras available for qualifying contributors to contribute 360¬∞ street-level pictures. To read conditions and apply: https://openstreetmap.be/en/2023/10/07/european-camera-grant.html Cc: @openstreetmap #GoPro #Mapillary #KartaView #Panoramax #OpenStreetMap
This issue of #OpenStreetMap Belgium Mapper of the Month #MotM virtually flies to Italy to let us meet Lorenzo Stucchi: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2023/10/01/lorenzo-stucchi.html

Plan a running route with these 5 free run planner websites https://www.ilovefreesoftware.com/06/featured/plan-a-running-route-free-run-planner-websites.html. Unsurprisingly, 3 are using OpenStreetMap data. This also means you can correct and add paths yourself if you ever notice some are wrong or missing. #OpenStreetMap #running #planner cc: @openstreetmap

OpenStreetMap Foundation launched consultations on their strategic plan v2. You can provide your ideas and inputs via the community forum or on the mailing list. https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/08/18/for-community-consultation-osmf-strategic-plan-v-2/ #OpenStreetMap #OSMF cc: @openstreetmap

Announcing State of the Map 2024 in Nairobi (and online) on 6-8 September 2024 https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/08/14/announcing-state-of-the-map-2024-september-6-to-8-2024-join-us-in-nairobi-and-online/ #OpenStreetMap #SotM cc: @openstreetmap

Hawa Adinani explains how contributing to #OpenStreetMap has transformed her: ‚ÄúWe often talk about how OpenStreetMap contributes to various initiatives like disaster responses, urban planning, land use analysis, and research. However, I believe we‚Äôre not doing justice to OSM by not sharing how it has profoundly impacted our personal lives.‚Äù Read more at https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Hawa%20Adinani/diary/402134.

#OpenStreetMap Belgium‚Äôs Mapper of the Month #MotM is @joost_schouppe. If the name sounds familiar to you, it might be for many reasons. It could be for his past involvement as OpenStreetMap Foundation #OSMF board member, for leading the Belgian community chapter, or being a very active mapper. Read the interview at https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2023/08/01/joost-schouppe.html. cc: @openstreetmap

Interesting paper from #MDPI about ‚ÄúMapping with #ChatGPT‚Äù concludes it delivers unique advantages, such as: - lowering the barrier to producing maps - boosting the efficiency of massive map production - and understanding geographical space with its spatial thinking capability. Limitations cited are: - its unequal benefits for different users (need to have some expertise already) - and necessary user intervention for quality control. https://www.mdpi.com/2220-9964/12/7/284 cc: @openstreetmap

A nice comprehensive post explaining why State of the Map Conferences #SotM are so important to #OpenStreetMap: https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2023/07/07/why-state-of-the-map-conferences-are-so-important-to-osm/ Already attended one? Cc: @openstreetmap

For this #OpenStreetMap Belgium‚Äôs Mapper of the Month #MotM entry, the spotlight is on Michel Hebert from #Grenoble, France: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2023/07/01/michel-hebert.html. He will probably be known by the people following @OsmGrenoble. Cc: @openstreetmap

OSM Relatify is a new web tool designed to simplify the process of editing public transport relations in #OpenStreetMap. A key feature is the smart routing logic to automatically construct bus routes from given bus stops and ways, taking into account factors like one-way streets and roundabouts. https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/NorthCrab/diary/401755 #OSMRelatify Screenshot of OSM Relatify, a tool to simplify editing public transport relations within OpenStreetMap

This month, the #OpenStreetMap Belgium‚Äôs Mapper of the Month #MotM is @zverik (Ilya), probably already known to you for his #Everydoor or #OSMCards projects (and a lot more, of course): https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2023/06/01/zverev.html.
What Android app would you recommend to convert geo coordinates in different formats? Ideally, Free software. #geocaching #FOSS #Android
Is there a public web tool to a draw circle on an #OpenStreetMap map to measure the straight-line distance between places?
The #OpenStreetMap Belgium series of Mapper of the Month #MotM interviews is home again with Jean-Louis Stanus: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2023/05/01/jeanlouis-stanus.html.
A nice and comprehensive #OpenStreetMap How-To on ‚ÄúMapping a turbo roundabout with #JOSM‚Äù: https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/Peter%20Elderson/diary/401459.

#OpenStreetMap mapper ivanbranco shares his list of favourite OSM-related tools/websites/apps: https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/ivanbranco/diary/401437. There are certainly some you‚Äôll discover or rediscover.
